alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 7:40PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND IMPACTING I-70 BETWEEN DENVER AND LIMON... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 737 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 4 miles east of Lindon to near Deer Trail to 9 miles northeast of Kiowa, or along a line extending from 31 miles south of Akron to 30 miles northwest of Limon to 39 miles southeast of Denver and moving south at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Limon, Deer Trail, Arriba, Genoa, Agate, Cottonwood Valley, Lindon and Last Chance. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 319 and 383. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
